security: Revelation of his identity and of his past association with us would be dangerous to his security.
summary: This document provides responses to the SSC's request for additional information on Project ZRRIFLE, clarifying cryptonyms, pseudonyms, and aliases used by individuals involved in the project.
summary_one_paragraph: On September 17, 1975, a response was issued to the SSC's request for more information regarding Project ZRRIFLE; this response clarifies various cryptonyms and pseudonyms associated with individuals involved. The document specifies that the cryptonym FUTURE is likely a garble for FI/LA Division's FUTURE, assigned to a U.S. citizen operating abroad as a reporting source, whose true identity is withheld for security reasons. It also identifies KUTUBE as referring to FI Staff (now Operations Staff), LIVID as a sensitive foreign operational target, and LAURICLE as an action indicator for FI/D. Further, it reveals that Monroe B. ROZENEY, Ed JOUVENOY, Wanda CRICKARD, and James N. RABNEY are pseudonyms for various officers and clerks, including IDENTITY A (Oliver M. Silsby), an officer actively involved in clandestine operations, and IDENTITY B (Elizabeth A. McNeill), a former Agency employee.
title: Responses to SSC Request for Additional Information on Project ZRRIFLE
